page.title: 02Thurlow village school
page.content: Thurlow voluntary controlled primary school caters for 53 children aged between 5 and 9 years, in 2 classes with 1 part time and 2 full time capable caring teachers and 4 ancillary staff. Recent national teachers' union action seems to have had little relevance or impact here. The pleasant airy semi-open plan building is 18 years old and the continuity of this village is such that many parents and grandparents were themselves taught at the original Little Thurlow school or the Great Thurlow school which is now the Estate office. Children travel from Cowlinge, Great and Little Bradley, Wratting and Withersfield as well as Thurlow. A few walk, some come on the school bus, parents share lifts. The atmosphere is happy and relaxed with the colourful results of the childrens' work.
